channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.description: I have been a fan ofFormula One racinglong before it became the “new, cool thing.” For a few decades, in fact.

item.title: Killer set for execution 43 years after Bay County…
item.description: TALLAHASSEE — More than 43 years after Janet White was abducted from a Bay County insurance office and murdered, Gov. Ron DeSantis on Friday signed a death warrant for convicted killer Kayle Barrington Bates.

item.title: Florida Lottery Mega Millions, Jackpot Triple Play…
item.description: TheFlorida Lotteryoffers several draw games for those hoping to win one of the available jackpots. Here’s a look at the winning numbers for games played on Friday, July 18, 2025

item.title: NOAA watches Atlantic tropical disturbance. What to know…
item.description: The National Hurricane Center is watching an area of disorganized weather in the Atlantic moving east to west, but the chances it will develop are low and conditions aren't favorable for the showers and thunderstorms to come together as as something stronger, forecasters say.

item.title: Football Recruiting 2026: Florida high school summer…
Who is Sarasota-Manatee's all-time best state…
item.description: The Herald-Tribune has gone back and documented the area baseball teams that have won state championships.

item.title: Comparing Alligator Alcatraz to concentration camps is offensive
item.description: The accusation by Rev. Leo F. Armbrust that“Alligator Alcatraz” is a concentration campmakes my blood boil.

item.title: Free, self-serve Sarasota County sandbag locations open Saturday
item.description: Sarasota County is offering free, voluntary, self-service sandbag locations this Saturday, July 19, to help residents in protecting their homes and property from potential flooding as they prepare for storms this hurricane season.
